clinical_study.brief_title: Quality of Life After Bariatric Surgery
clinical_study.official_title: Quality of Life After Bariatric Surgery

collaborator.agency: Central Adelaide Local Health Network Incorporated

brief_summary.textblock: This study aims to assess long term outcomes for patients who have underwent bariatric surgery. In particular, it aims to assess the quality of life of these participants.

primary_outcome.measure: Quality of life before and after bariatric surgery
primary_outcome.time_frame: This represents the patients current quality of life within the last 4 weeks.
primary_outcome.description: Difference in SF-36 between post-bariatric surgical patients and representative pre-operative patients who have not undergone bariatric surgery (quality of life).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: This is the patients current weight within the last 4 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: This represents the patients current weight in kilograms.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Retrospectively reviewed on average of 5 years
secondary_outcome.description: This represents the patients lowest weight after bariatric surgery

arm_group.description: This is the group of participants who suffer from obesity and are awaiting bariatric surgery.
This is the group of participants who suffer from obesity and have received bariatric surgery.

intervention.description: Bariatric surgery includes sleeve gastrectomy and gastric bypass.

study_pop.textblock:
Pre-operative Group The pre-operative population will be patients who have been referred to TQEH bariatric clinic however have not yet had their initial appointment. The 150 participants who have been on the waiting list for the longest period of time will be included in the pre-operative group.
Post-operative Group The post-operative population will be the 140 patients who underwent bariatric surgery at TQEH between 2008 and 2018. This resulted in 146 operations.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Obese, either received bariatric surgery or have been referred for bariatric surgery.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Emergency cases, Obese patients who have not been referred for bariatric surgery.
